intro: Sondera orbiculata, commonly known as the orbiculate sondera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its orbicular (rounded) leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are often brightly colored. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
